description: From Middle English gilden, gelden, gulden, from Old English gylden, from Proto-West Germanic *gulþīn, from Proto-Germanic *gulþīnaz (“golden”), from *gulþą (“gold”), equivalent to gold +‎ -en. Cognate with Dutch gulden, German gülden, Swedish gyllen.

adjectives.description: gilden (comparative more gilden, superlative most gilden)

verbs.description: gilden (third-person singular simple present gildens, present participle gildening, simple past and past participle gildened)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To make or become golden or gilded
